00028 
00029 /** @brief Structure for configuration settings
00030  *
00031  * To initialize the nanoLOC chip to a specific transmission mode
00032  * all necessary parameters are combined in this structure.
00033  */
00034 typedef struct
00035 {
00036     uint8_t    bw;          /**< Bandwidth                  */
00037     uint8_t    sd;          /**< Symbolduration             */
00038     uint8_t    sr;          /**< Symbolrate                 */
00039     uint8_t    fdma;            /**< Fdma (22MHz) or 80MHz mode */
00040     uint8_t    fixnmap;     /**< Fixed or map mode          */
00041     uint8_t  fec;
00042     double rangingConst_FECon;  /**< Ranging constant fec on        */
00043     double rangingConst_FECoff; /**< Ranging constant fec off   */
00044     uint16_t     rangingTimeout;/**< cbo add comment            */
00045     uint16_t     rangingFastTimeout; /**< cbs add comment       */
00046 }PhyModeSetT;
00047 
00048 extern PhyModeSetT modeSet;
00049 
00050 /** @brief structure type for all layer configuration settings
00051  *
00052  * To be IEEE layer complient, all configuration data is stored
00053  * in one data structure that can be set or read by an upper layer.
00054  */
00055 typedef struct
00056 {
00057     uint8_t CAMode;         /**< cca/csma mode */
00058     uint32_t titxstart;     /**< hwclock of last tx start cmd, used for CA timeout */
00059     uint8_t currentChannel; /**< selected channel. */
00060     uint8_t logChannel;     /**< logical channel id. */
00061 
00062     uint8_t txPower;        /**< tx power setting for the transmitter. */
00063     uint8_t rxState;        /**< receiver state. */
00064     uint8_t txState;        /**< transmitter state. */
00065 
00066     uint8_t macAddr0[6];    /**< 1st MAC address of nanoLOC chip. */
00067     uint8_t macAddr1[6];    /**< 2nd MAC address of nanoLOC chip. */
00068     uint8_t txAddrSel;      /**< selection for MAC addr 0 / 1. */
00069     uint8_t arqMax;         /**< max number of retransmissions before no ack 0 - 14. */
00070     uint8_t arqMode;        /**< hardware acks enabled or disabled */
00071     uint8_t addrMatch;      /**< promisc / auto mode. */
00072     uint8_t rawMode;        /**< raw / auto mode. */
00073     uint8_t trxMode;        /**< trx mode. */
00074     uint32_t recalInterval;  /**< time interval in ms for recalibration */
00075     uint32_t lastRecalibration;  /**< last recalibration */
00076     uint32_t phyRxTimeout;  /**< timeout if no packet received [ms] */
00077     uint8_t pwrDownMode;    /**< 0 full 1 pad 2 up */
00078     uint8_t frameType;      /**< supported frame types */
00079     uint8_t testmode;       /**< set cont. chirp or carrier mode */
00080     uint8_t syncword[8];    /**< syncword for communication */
00081     uint8_t     rxOn;           /**< is rx already started */
00082     uint8_t fec;            /**< fec on or off */
00083     uint8_t pwrUp;          /**< mark power up condition */
00084     uint8_t pwrDown;        /**< mark ntrx state */
00085     uint8_t     ant;            /**< mark last selected antenna */
00086 } PhyPIB;
00087 
00088 extern bool_t  ntrxRun;
00089 extern uint8_t ntrxIrqStatus[2];
00090 extern uint8_t ntrxBBStatus;
00091 extern uint8_t ntrxState;
00092 extern uint8_t ntrxCal;

00095 #define SHADOWREGCOUNT        128
00096 /* COldfire timer for 66Mhz */
00097 #define DELAY_20us      hwdelay(40) /* 20 */
00098 #define DELAY_100us     hwdelay(130)
00099 #define DELAY_800us     hwdelay(3200) /* 1100 */
00100 #define DELAY_20ms  { hwdelay(8000); hwdelay(8000); hwdelay (8000); hwdelay (3000); }
00101 #define RfTxOutputPowerData_DEFAULT         0x3f
00102 #define RfTxOutputPowerReq_DEFAULT          0x3f
00103 #define NTRX_MAX_CHANNEL_ID 17

00106 #define TxSEND      0x01
00107 #define TxWAIT      0x02
00108

00110 #define TxCAL       0x01
00111 #define RxCAL       0x02
00112 #define AllCAL      0x03

00186 /**
00187  * @def NTRX_RSSI_BUSY_THRESHOLD
00188  * @brief If the measured RSSI value is @em below this value the radio channel
00189  * should be assumed busy.
00190  * @see NTRXInitRssi
00191  */
00192 #define NTRX_RSSI_BUSY_THRESHOLD    (0x10)
